DoD source is one of the best WWII shooters out there. It's fun to play, the shooting is satisfying, and the graphics look surprisingly good. The art style is also very appealing. Valve did a very good job at balancing the two factions, mostly the rifleman class of both. The Germans have a Kar98k bolt action and the US have the garand. The Kar98 is mostly a one shot in the chest and the garand is a 1-2 shot kill but less accurate and it excells in close quarters. I would very much recommend picking this game up for the low price of $9.99.

Fantasic, and well worth the money if you want a good, team-based FPS. There are two-man caps, where you MUST have a teammate with you to capture a point. There are TONS of custom maps, to help increase the games' replay value.

There's even a game mode that many people don't know about, it's called escort.
http://www.netday.be/games/dod/maps/dod-v2/review/en/

This is a fantastic FPS, a lot like CS:S but even more difficult. I've met a lot of deaths in this game, but I never felt for a second that they were cheap or unfair. Unlike Call of Duty & Battlefield, I was never frustrated and angry. Rather, I was impressed by how accurate and predictive the enemy players were. The community is very teamplay oriented, as it rightfully should be. Going solo is not an option in this game. You really do learn to be cautious when you die in only one or two hits from the high-powered rifles & machine guns, and three or four from everything else. I have little to complain about with this game, it's a definite recommend! Pick it up and give it a try ASAP!
Challenging and excellent, but showing its age.

Day of Defeat is an extremely fun and addicting multiplayer shooter. Many people may tell you that the game sucks, but that's probably because they're addicted to spray-and-pray games like Call of Duty. In Day of Defeat, it requires more strategy, and is by far more realistic. Anybody who enjoys studying WWII and playing games will find this a nice treat. Play and would recommend everyone to try who have not yet felt on his entire "beauty" of this game!

Day of Defeat: Source was, just like Counter-Strike: Source, an update to Valve's new Source engine. I'm not aware at all of how the original Day of Defeat fared, as I never played it, therefore I can't make a proper comparison between the two.

What I can talk about though, is obviously Day of Defeat: Source, having played it quite a bit and having fun with it. The game is set in WW2, and while a lot of games are set in WW2, nowadays with the massive trend of current and near future FPSes lately, it is remarkably a refreshing change.

Source obviously made the maps and models look much better than the original game. They still hold up quite well nowadays, much like Source itself in any case, so for most people there won't be much of a problem when it comes to graphical fidelity.

While I don't know how the gameplay in the original DoD was like, if it was anything like CS 1.6 to CS: Source, it may have ruffled a few feathers on the original DoD community upon DoD: Source's release. Or maybe it didn't, because of the gameplay.

The gameplay is most definitely this game's strong point by a long shot. There are several classes to pick from, varied enough to justify their presence in the game, and fully suit the setting, just like the various weapons you have. The shooting feels good, just like most of the FPSes in Source.

Unfortunately, it suffers from not having a whole lot of variety to it, both in game modes and in maps. And by now, there are naturally also other FPSes set in WW2 that feel and play a lot better than DoD: Source. There's still a community present, so you should have no difficulties jumping into a multiplayer game however.

I would get this game. It's cheap and can be an enjoyable and refreshing game experience once in a while. Plus it's a Valve game, and those come with a lot of obvious perks. (Garry's Mod models being an example) Just don't expect too much out of it.

I've been playing DOD since the mod first came out. I've got hundreds of hours of enjoyment out of the game as I've always been a fan of the WWII genre. It's always been my go to and lately the gungame mod has been my favorite form of deathmatch style multiplayer!

I played the original mod for Half-Life and it was great.  It was a nice change of pace when you sick of playing Team Fortress Classic.  The sequel didn't really capture the magic of the original.  

Day of Defeat: Source is a World War II first person shooting game.  It's pretty good but I never really got into it.  It doesn't help that Valve basically abandoned the game very early on.  The only thing keeping this game going are 14 year old boys who like to pretend to be Nazis for a little while.

CSS в антураже Второй Мировой войны, причем именно той её части. где было вооружённое столкновение между фашистами и союзниками.

 Боты есть, но, опять же, это лишь ступень тренировки к выходу в мультиплеер. Ибо только лишь с живыми людьми играя есть возможность получить всю полноту ощущений, почувствовать драйв от игрушки. Никаких графических изысков в игрушке нет, как таковые они здесь и не нужны. Побегать, пострелять пару-тройку матчей вечерком самое то на мой взгляд.

Day of Defeat:Source is an online WW2 FPS. It starting out as a Half-Life Mod is one of Valves lesser known titles. I really enjoyed this game and still do, I hope the online communtiy can get as many players as it used too. It's game that is too good to be put down, it really stands out for me. Not only does it offer strategic gameplay,intense FPS skills, and overall replaybility, but it offers a almost immersive enviroment that I've spent some of my best gaming experinces in. I don't want to see this game die, and I hope it will become popular again.
